definitions.text: someone who cleans soot from chimneys
winning all or all but one of the tricks in bridge
a long oar used in an open boat
(American football) an attempt to advance the ball by running around the end of the line

examples: Her long skirt brushed the floor
A gasp swept cross the audience

definitions.text: move with sweeping, effortless, gliding motions
examples: The diva swept into the room
Shreds of paper sailed through the air
The searchlights swept across the sky

definitions.text: sweep with a broom or as if with a broom
examples: Sweep the crumbs off the table

definitions.text: force into some kind of situation, condition, or course of action
examples: They were swept up by the events
don't drag me into this business

definitions.text: to cover or extend over an area or time period; ,
win an overwhelming victory in or on
examples: Her new show dog swept all championships

definitions.text: make a big sweeping gesture or movement
